history.content:
Hello! My name is Aris Richardson and I’m the President of Effective Altruism at Berkeley. I’m hosting a mini-contest on AI Alignment called the AIMS Contest and am planning to scale this up by the end of the semester. The scaled-up contest will be offering prizes as large as $5,000 in order to attract talented applicants who are familiar with computer science. 

 

In order to scale up, I’m hiring one or two people to do advertising for $30 per hour, up to 50 hours of work (or 25 hours for two people) before the end of the semester. The start date for this position is flexible and can be negotiated with applicants. The person who takes on this position will work directly with me as they manage the outreach for a $20,000 AI project. 

 

Job Description

Specific actions that you would take as the AIMS advertiser include, but aren’t limited to: 

  • Contacting leaders of CS (and related) groups on campus and scheduling one-on-ones to meet with them and discuss the contest

  • Contacting professors to make advertising announcements at the start of CS classes

  • Coordinating online advertising

  • Purchasing flyers and posters to distribute

  • Thinking of new ways to advertise and build club connections 

 

Some benefits of the job are: 

  • Flexible hours

  • Autonomy 

  • Networking with CS students on campus

  • Potential networking with AI Alignment professionals and general EA professionals

  • Improving operations and management skills 

  • Being able to add to your resume the experience of coordinating a $20,000 project in a student-run team

 

Qualifications

A person who takes on this role should fit this description:  

  • You are currently a student (grad or undergrad) at UC Berkeley. 

  • You are comfortable making announcements to large groups of people.

  • You are comfortable reaching out to strangers and having meetings with strangers.

  • You have the capacity to spend 5-10 hours per week on this role for the rest of the semester.

  • You are proactive and complete work without supervision.

  • You can understand the AIMS contest description well enough to answer basic questions (I will help clarify any questions you have about the contest).

 

It is not required, but helpful if you also fit these descriptions: 

  • You have heard of the ELK Contest or AI Alignment work before.

  • You enjoy talking to new people. 

  • You consider yourself to be well-connected to the CS (and related major) community at Cal. 

  • You are a CS or related major.

  • You have been involved in CS student groups at Cal. 

  • You have experience with Effective Altruism. 

 

If you’re still reading this post, you might be a great fit for the role! If so, you should fill out this application (which should only take a few minutes). Interested in the contest itself? You can sign up for more information with our interest form. 

 

Applications will be accepted on a rolling basis, so the earlier you apply, the better your chances of being hired. Ideally, we would like for interested applicants to apply by Friday the 8th of April, but the sooner the better. Top applicants will be reached out to in order to schedule a short interview with myself before a final decision is made about hiring. 

 

Feel free to email me at alarichardson@berkeley.edu with any questions!
history.subject: [Job Opportunity] Advertising for Large-Scale AI Project
